alert.note: Alert for Dunklin (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 12:52AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Clay and northeastern Dunklin Counties through 115 AM CST... At 1252 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Saint Francis, or near Campbell, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Malden, Piggott, Campbell, Chalk Bluff Natural Area, Clarkton, Holcomb, St. Francis, Saint Francis, Glennonville, Nimmons, Bell City, Carryville, Rhyne, Valley Ridge, Providence, Morris State Park, Wilhelmina, Brian, Chalk Bluff Battlefield Park and Baird. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
